title: Wear Network Notifier
summary: An app for Android Wear that keeps you up to date on which network you are on.
description: App for Android Wear that's very handy when it comes to keeping you up to date on which network your handheld device is on. It will send a notification to your wearable when your handheld changes its network. You will never have to take your phone out of your pocket again to check if you are on Wifi, LTE, EDGE or any other network.Wear notifications for: - WIFI connections - Mobile connections (GPRS, EDGE, 3G, HSPA, LTE) - Bluetooth connections - any other connection8 beautiful backgroundsOptions: - Enable vibrate on notifications - Choose network types that send notifications - Choose background
descriptionHTML:
App for Android Wear that's very handy when it comes to keeping you up to date on which network your handheld device is on. It will send a notification to your wearable when your handheld changes its network. You will never have to take your phone out of your pocket again to check if you are on Wifi, LTE, EDGE or any other network.

Wear notifications for:
- WIFI connections
- Mobile connections (GPRS, EDGE, 3G, HSPA, LTE)
- Bluetooth connections
- any other connection

8 beautiful backgrounds

Options:
- Enable vibrate on notifications
- Choose network types that send notifications
- Choose background
comments: Disappointing Works OK. But it doesn't respect the do-not-disturb flag.  So even thought every other wear app goes silent (and let's me sleep) when I set the DND flag on the watch, this app did not.  Fix that and I'll happily reinstall and give 5 stars.

Not all notifications work on Marshmallow Since upgrading to Marshmallow on my Nexus 6, my watch no longer receive WiFi notifications unless Mobile data is DISABLED, then WiFi notifications seem to work again.
Pretty useful Can be a little buggy under Marshmallow and desperately needs a plain/system UI background.
Works well Gives me a notification when I go offline even when I have ticked it off in the setting.
No update in eight months Used to work really well but no update in eight months = doesn't work properly on Marshmallow = Uninstalled
Kick ass app... I think it could be made slightly better in terms of stability but that might be just a matter of my phone using an older OS version than my watch...
recentChanges: â˜… Show notification on top (as priority notification)
